item.title: Proactive safeguarding with Conduktor Gateway
item.description: In this article, we discuss how safeguarding can be used to prevent outages and respond gracefully to change. Most organizations have some safeguarding policies in place, we've laid out the three most common stages of safeguarding and how Conduktor Gateway can help you prevent avoidable Kafka issues.

item.title: Enhance Apache Kafka with Conduktor Gateway
item.description: We're excited to launch Conduktor Gateway on our Marketplace to provide central platform teams responsible for Kafka with enhanced functionality. Enforce best practices, improve your governance, and reduce your cost.

item.title: The story of Conduktor Gateway
item.description: In this article, we discuss why Conduktor felt now is the right time to introduce Conduktor Gateway to the world. Florent Ramiere shares his journey with Kafka from being a beginner to completing his first Kafka projects, his first mistakes, and how his approach to Kafka changed throughout this journey.

item.title: What is a Data Mesh?
item.description: Data mesh is a paradigm that decentralizes data ownership and governance, enabling data domains to share and collaborate.

item.title: Key Learnings from Our 2023 Offsite
item.description: This past March, the entire Conduktor team met outside of Paris for its fourth offsite event. CEO Nicolas Orban shares highlights and key learnings from our latest team gathering.

item.title: Security for humans and applications in Apache Kafka
item.description: In this article, we will discuss the two most viable ways to protect and provide access to resources inside of your Apache Kafka deployment. In addition, we'll discuss how your choice of trusted or untrusted entities impacts your auth strategy.

item.title: What is Change Data Capture Anyways?
item.description: Learn what Change Data Capture (CDC) is, its use cases, and mechanisms.

item.description: In this blog we'll go over Data Integration. What is it? Why is it? What are some of the benefits? Then, let's look at the how.

item.description: We are proud to announce the launch of our Playground, giving Conduktor Cloud users access to two free Apache Kafka clusters for experimentation.

item.title: Topic as a Service: Automate Governance Decisions for Apache Kafka
item.description: Kafka's widespread usage has introduced problems related to governance, as different teams combine their Kafkas. Topic as a Service for the Conduktor Platform was built to help solve these issues.

item.title: KRaft Quorum: How to run Kafka without Zookeeper
item.description: In this article, weâ€™ll discuss what Zookeeper is, what its role is, its limitations, and how KRaft mode mitigates those limitations.

item.title: Conduktor Monitoring and Alerting - Deep Dive
item.description: Monitoring and Alerts are vital for the long term health of systems, and Kafka is no different. Unfortunately, no solutions exist that have been configured especially for Kafka - until now. Conduktor Platform delivers seamless monitoring and instant alerts.

item.description: Explore the difference between the two storage paradigms of data lakes and data warehouses. Learn the pros and cons of each and which situations they are suited for.

item.title: Kafka Partition Assignment Strategy
item.description: Kafka consumers pull data from topic partitions, but what happens if a consumer dies? How will the partitions be reassigned, and what is the best method of reassignment? This article looks at the partition.assignment.strategy configuration and the different options it enables.

item.title: What is the Schema Registry and why do you need to use it?

item.description: Apache Kafka is a commit-log system. Kafka allows us to optimize the log-related configurations. These configurations can impact broker performance, and we'll show you how to optimize settings in this article.

item.title: How Replication and ISR work in Apache Kafka
item.description: Kafka works on the basic model of decoupling the source system and target system, so instead of Source systems (Producers) directly sending data to the target system, now Source systems publish data to Kafka and Target systems or Consumers subscribes to these events to get data directly from Kafka.
